concept_data.title: member of the EC Court of Auditors
concept_data.category_name: EU institutions and European civil service
concept_data.category_full: 1006 EU institutions and European civil service
concept_data.preferred_term: member of the Court of Auditors (EU)

summary: A "member of the Court of Auditors (EU)" plays a crucial role in ensuring the financial accountability of the European Union. This institution, comprising individuals like Ovidiu, Ispir, and Fernand, is tasked with auditing the EU's finances, thereby enhancing transparency and integrity. Members such as Gijs, Vries, and Grethen contribute to the oversight of budgetary expenditures, ensuring compliance with legal frameworks. The Court's work, involving figures like Lothar, Haase, and Lelong, is vital for maintaining public trust. Through rigorous evaluations, members like Moreno and Sarmas uphold the principles of sound financial management, reflecting the EU's commitment to accountability and governance.
